item.title: 尼日利亚计划于2026年通过国内绿色债券筹集10亿美元
item.description: 尼日利亚正寻求投资者支持其计划今年发行的1.5万亿奈拉（10亿美元）绿色债券。【原文：Nigeria is seeking backers for a 1.5 trillion naira ($1 billion) green bond it aims to issue this year.】

item.title: 全球正经历"极端"气温飙升
item.description: 2025年全球平均气温数据出炉，情况不容乐观。去年成为有记录以来第三热的年份，仅次于……前两年。【原文：The global average temperature numbers are in for 2025 and they’re not good. Last year was the third-hottest on record, trailing only … the previous two years.】

item.title: 英国在海上风电拍卖中大幅增加支持力度
item.description: 尽管成本不断攀升，英国仍加大了对海上风电场的支持力度，以加速实现2030年清洁能源的宏伟目标。【原文：Britain stepped up support for offshore wind farms despite rising prices, as it races to meet an ambitious 2030 clean-power goal.】

item.title: 波兰回收企业豪掷数百万押注欧洲关键金属战略
item.description: 欧洲正积极寻求在关键材料市场立足，这有望使波兰最大的回收企业受益，因为该地区正致力于减少对中国依赖。【原文：Europe’s push to get a foothold in the critical materials market is poised to benefit Poland’s biggest recycling company as the continent looks to cut its reliance on China.】

item.title: 曼谷醒来时，有毒空气正窒息着中央商务区
item.description: 曼谷居民清晨醒来时，天空笼罩着一片朦胧的污染雾霾，当局敦促该市主要商业和金融中心区域的居民尽量留在室内。【原文：Bangkok residents woke up to a hazy, polluted sky, with authorities urging people in the city’s main business and financial hubs to stay indoors.】

item.title: 科学家证实2025年为史上第三热年份，仅次于2024年和2023年
item.description:
去年是有记录以来最温暖的一年之一，尽管拉尼娜天气现象本应使全球气温下降。 

【原文：

Last year was one of the warmest on record, even with a La Niña weather cycle that worked to cool the world down. 

】

item.title: 英国精算师对低估气候风险的损失模型敲响警钟
item.description: 英国主要精算师协会最新研究指出，金融业正依赖低估气温上升速度的气候模型。【原文：The finance industry is relying on climate models that understate the speed at which temperatures are rising, according to a fresh study by Britain’s main association of actuaries.】

item.title: 纽约要求数据中心支付更高电费
item.description: 纽约州计划要求数据中心运营商承担更多高能耗设施的电力成本，旨在防止电力需求激增推高家庭水电费。【原文：New York plans to require data center operators to shoulder more of the cost of powering their energy-hungry facilities, aiming to prevent surging electricity demand from pushing up household utility bills.】

item.title: 奥斯特德海上风电项目在与特朗普的法律纠纷中重启
item.description: 特朗普政府在打击风电的法律战中遭遇挫败。法官裁定风电开发商奥斯特德公司可重启罗德岛州近海"革命风电"项目的建设。【原文：The Trump administration has lost a legal battle in its war on wind. A judge has ruled that wind developer Orsted can restart construction on its Revolution Wind project off the coast of Rhode Island.】

item.title: 美国环保署在制定空气污染法规时将不再考虑人类健康效益的价值
item.description:
该机构正在放弃一项长期政策，即通过减少某些污染物来计算避免死亡和疾病所带来的经济节约。【原文：

The agency is abandoning a longstanding policy to calculate the monetary savings in avoided deaths and disease from cutting certain pollutants.

】

item.title: 尼日利亚计划发行3.52亿美元绿色债券用于气候项目
item.description: 尼日利亚计划今年通过发行绿色债券筹集高达5000亿奈拉（约合3.52亿美元），借此满足投资者强劲需求。作为非洲最大产油国，该国正转向气候相关债券融资，以支持环保项目并实现融资渠道多元化。【原文：Nigeria plans to raise as much as 500 billion naira ($352 million) through green bonds this year, tapping strong investor appetite as Africa’s biggest oil producer turns to climate-linked debt to fund environmental projects and diversify its financing base.】

item.title: 埃奎诺尔采取政治与法律手段解除帝国风电项目停工令
item.description: 挪威国家石油公司首席执行官安德斯·奥佩达尔表示，该公司正采取政治和法律双重途径，力图重启其在纽约近海陷入困境的帝国风电项目。【原文：Equinor ASA is taking both a political and legal approach to revive its beleaguered Empire Wind project off the coast of New York, said Chief Executive Officer Anders Opedal.】

item.title: 数据中心和煤炭推动美国2025年排放量上升
item.description:
该国温室气体排放量估计增长了2.4%，扭转了此前两年的下降趋势。【原文：

The country’s greenhouse gas emissions grew by an estimated 2.4%, reversing the downward trend of the previous two years. 

】

item.title: 摩根大通称需为能源转型中的更多波动性做好准备
item.description: 摩根大通公司表示，全球能源转型的前景可能比投资者预期的更为动荡。【原文：The outlook for the global energy transition is likely to be more volatile than investors may have expected, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 尼日利亚计划通过碳交易实现每年30亿美元的收入目标
item.description: 尼日利亚批准了一项框架协议，将这个非洲最大经济体之一纳入大规模排放配额交易体系，目标是每年从碳市场获得高达30亿美元的收入。【原文：Nigeria is targeting as much as $3 billion a year in carbon-market revenue after approving a framework that opens one of Africa’s largest economies to large-scale trading of emission allowances.】

item.title: 企业预算中蕴藏着1.3万亿美元未开发的应对气候变化资本
item.description:
一家荷兰非营利组织对全球约1600家企业进行分析后发现，目前用于低碳项目的支出占比中位数仅为7%。

【原文：

A Dutch nonprofit analyzed about 1,600 companies worldwide and found the median share of spending currently devoted to low-carbon projects is just 7%.

】

item.title: Insured Losses From Wildfires, Storms and Floods Hit Record High
item.description: Never before has the insurance industry faced such big losses tied to floods, severe thunderstorms and wildfires, according to a fresh study that links rising temperatures to increasingly dangerous weather patterns.

item.title: 法国未能实现2025年温室气体减排目标
item.description: 法国在温室气体减排目标方面进展滞后，这进一步表明欧洲最大经济体将难以实现其2030年气候目标。【原文：France is lagging behind targeted cuts in greenhouse gas emissions, adding to signs that Europe’s largest economies will struggle to reach their 2030 climate goals.】

item.title: 报告显示中印两国燃煤发电量罕见下滑
item.description: 一份新报告显示，全球两大煤炭发电国去年首次在50多年间减少了这种污染性化石燃料的发电量。【原文：The world’s two largest users of coal power both reduced generation from the polluting fossil fuel last year for the first time in more than 50 years, according to a new report.】

item.title: 奥斯特德获准重启特朗普叫停的美国风电项目
item.description: 美国法官裁定，奥斯特德公司可在对政府最新停工令提出上诉期间，重启罗德岛州近海风电场项目开发。这场针对可再生能源的持续争端中，丹麦能源巨头取得重大胜利。【原文：A US judge ruled Orsted A/S can resume development of a wind farm project off the coast of Rhode Island while it challenges the government’s latest stop-work order, a major win for the Danish energy giant in an ongoing fight with the Trump administration over renewable energy.】

item.title: 彭博新能源财经称，元宇宙项目需140亿美元新建反应堆
item.description: 据彭博新能源财经估算，新一代核能企业奥克洛公司和泰拉能源公司需投资逾140亿美元建造新型反应堆，以支持Meta Platforms Inc.的数据中心运营。【原文：Next-generation nuclear companies Oklo Inc. and TerraPower LLC will need to invest more than $14 billion in new reactors to support Meta Platforms Inc. data centers, according to estimates from BloombergNEF.】

item.title: 欧洲将发布中国电动汽车定价指南
item.description: 欧盟提出了一项框架方案，该方案将使中国汽车制造商的电动汽车免于缴纳高额进口关税，转而采用最低价格机制。【原文：The European Union offered a glimpse of a framework that would see Chinese automakers escape hefty import tariffs on their electric vehicles in favor of a minimum price mechanism.】

item.title: 暴风戈雷蒂过后，英国将遭遇雨雪侵袭，气象部门已发布预警
item.description: 随着风暴戈雷蒂的过境，预计周日英国全境将持续遭受包括降雪和暴雨在内的更多冬季天气侵袭。【原文：More wintry weather including snow and heavy rain is expected to batter the UK throughout Sunday in the wake of Storm Goretti.】

item.title: 伦敦千万英镑豪宅突现巨大裂缝
item.description:
伦敦居民正面临地基下沉风险的危险加剧，气候变化引发的破纪录高温正破坏着英国首都多数住宅所依托的黏土地基。【原文：

Londoners face a dangerous acceleration of subsidence risks, as record temperatures fueled by climate change destabilize the clay foundations on which most of the UK capital’s homes are built.

】

item.title: 高端餐厅为应对气候变化转向垃圾利用
item.description: 本周是食品界的大事，特朗普政府发布了新的膳食指南。未被纳入建议的？垃圾。【原文：It’s been a big week for food, with the Trump administration releasing new dietary guidelines. Not included in the recommendations? Trash.】

item.title: Australia’s Victoria Declares State of Disaster as Fires Rage
item.description: Australia’s southeastern state of Victoria — home to Melbourne — declared a state of disaster on Saturday as firefighters battled three emergency-level wildfires amid extreme heat and dry conditions.

item.title: Venezuela Has the Most Methane-Intensive Oil in the World
item.description: 特朗普政府希望美国企业能帮助委内瑞拉实现石油生产的现代化。然而，这一目标面临诸多障碍，包括该国严重的甲烷泄漏问题。【原文：The Trump administration wants American companies to modernize oil production in Venezuela. There are many roadblocks to that happening, though, including the country’s huge methane problem.】

item.title: 特朗普摧毁气候计划之际，盖茨警告"市场力量"不足以应对
item.description: The billionaire also said the world needs to put more of an emphasis on adapting to global warming as impacts worsen.

item.title: 卫星图像揭示委内瑞拉严重甲烷泄漏问题
item.description:
数据显示，该国老化能源基础设施正泄漏数百万吨甲烷，凸显出恢复生产所需付出的巨大努力。【原文：

Data shows millions of tons of methane spewing from the nation’s decaying energy infrastructure, underscoring how much work is required to revive production.

】

item.title: 风暴戈雷蒂席卷欧洲，狂风肆虐，电力中断
item.description: 风暴戈雷蒂以飓风级别的风力肆虐英法两国，席卷西北欧时造成大范围破坏，导致数十万户家庭断电。【原文：Storm Goretti lashed England and France with hurricane-force winds, causing widespread disruption as it swept through northwest Europe and cut power to hundreds of thousands of homes.】
